Verb[edit]

gehÃ¶ren (third-person singular simple present gehÃ¶rt, past tense gehÃ¶rte, past participle gehÃ¶rt, auxiliary haben)

  1. to belong to, be the property of (with dative)
    Das Buch gehÃ¶rt mir.
    The book belongs to me.
    Ihm gehÃ¶rt das ganze Land.
    The whole country belongs to him; he owns the whole country.
  2. to be a prerequisite for; to be a characteristic of (with zu)
    Es gehÃ¶rt sehr viel Selbstvertrauen dazu um so etwas zu tun.
    To do something like this needs a lot of self-confidence.
    Zu einem Feuerwehrmann gehÃ¶rt Mut und Tapferkeit.
    Being a fireman requires bravery and courage.
  3. to belong to, be a part of (with zu)
    Sachsen gehÃ¶rt zu Deutschland.
    Saxony belongs to Germany.
    Verbrennungen gehÃ¶ren zu den hÃ¤ufigen UnfÃ¤llen im Haushalt.
    Burns are among the commonest accidents in the home.
  4. (reflexive) to be proper
    Wie es sich gehÃ¶rt.
    As is right and proper.
    Das gehÃ¶rt sich nicht.
    That's just not done.
  5. ought to be
    Jemand, der so etwas tut, gehÃ¶rt verhaftet!
    Anyone who does such a thing ought to be arrested!
    Kinder gehÃ¶ren um diese Zeit ins Bett.
    Children belong in bed at this time.
